snippet: Johnny Hincapie has raised enough evidence to warrant a hearing on whether his guilty verdict in Brian Watkins’s death on a subway platform should be vacated, a judge ruled.
abstract: Justice Eduardo Padro of State Supreme Court rules that Johnny Hincapie, man convicted in 1990 killing of Utah tourist Brian Watkins on Manhattan subway platform, has raised enough new evidence to warrant hearing on whether his guilty verdict should vacated.
lead_paragraph: Johnny Hincapie has raised enough evidence to warrant a hearing on whether his guilty verdict in Brian Watkins’s death on a subway platform should be vacated, a judge ruled.

headline.seo: Hearing for Johnny Hincapie on Vacating Guilty Verdict in Brian Watkins’s Murder
headline.main: Hearing Is Set on Voiding Conviction in Murder of Utah Tourist
headline.print_headline: Hearing Is Set on Voiding Conviction in Murder of Utah Tourist
